Class LevelUIManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.demo.views.LevelUIManager
public class LevelUIManager extends Object
Manages the User Interface (UI) elements for each level.

This class is responsible for updating the level UI, displaying game over or win menus, and managing countdown timers and health bars.

  • Constructor Details

    • LevelUIManager

      public LevelUIManager(double screenWidth, double screenHeight, javafx.scene.Group root, Controller controller)
      Constructs a new LevelUIManager.
      Parameters:
      screenWidth - the width of the screen
      screenHeight - the height of the screen
      root - the root Group for the level
      controller - the game Controller

  • Method Details

    • updateLevelView

      public void updateLevelView(UserPlane user, LevelView levelView, Boss boss)
      Updates the level UI by removing hearts, updating boss health bars, and handling shields.
      Parameters:
      user - the player's UserPlane
      levelView - the LevelView instance for the level
      boss - the boss Boss (if applicable)

    • showGameOverMenu

      public void showGameOverMenu(Runnable restartLevel, Runnable goToMainMenu)
      Displays the game over menu with options to restart the level or go to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      restartLevel - the action to restart the current level
      goToMainMenu - the action to navigate to the main menu

    • showWinMenu

      public void showWinMenu(Runnable restartToLevelOne, Runnable goToMainMenu)
      Displays the win menu with options to restart or go to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      restartToLevelOne - the action to restart from Level 1
      goToMainMenu - the action to navigate to the main menu

    • startCountdown

      public void startCountdown(Runnable onComplete, String levelNumber)
      Starts a countdown timer before the level begins.
      Parameters:
      onComplete - the action to run when the countdown ends
      levelNumber - the number of the level as a string

    • createButton

      private javafx.scene.layout.StackPane createButton(String name, javafx.scene.text.Font font, Runnable action)
